item.description:
Several people have requested this.

 

The screenwriter of Slumdog Millionaire (Simon Beaufoy) and the director of Chocolat (Lasse Hallström) have collaborated on a romantic comedy for grownups with a taste for the winningly absurd. A Yemeni sheikh (Amr Waked) who’s fallen under the spell of fly-fishing in Scotland dreams up a crazy plan: to stock his own (very dry) country with 10,000 North Atlantic salmon. Hoping for a diplomatic coup, the British government gives the green light, but it falls to a skeptical civil servant (Ewan McGregor) and the sheikh’s optimistic assistant (Emily Blunt) to make the impossible a reality. “Makes use of pink-fleshed vertebrates as the inspiration for musings on love and life, faith and patience - and the courage to go against the flow.” - Amy Biancolli, San Francisco Chronicle.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby, collecting tickets. It's my day to volunteer.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Salmon Fishing in The Yemen
